001package imagingbook.pub.hough.lines;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
004
005import java.awt.Color;
006import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
007
008import ij.gui.Roi;
009import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
010import imagingbook.lib.ij.CustomOverlay;
011
012public class HoughLineOverlay extends CustomOverlay<HoughLine> {
013        
014        private final int width, height;
015        
016        /**
017         * Constructor.
018         * The dimensions of the target frame (used to show this overlay)
019         * must be specified.
020         * @param width the width of the target frame.
021         * @param height the height of the target frame.
022         */
023        public HoughLineOverlay(int width, int height) {
024                this.width = width;
025                this.height = height;
026        }
027
028        /**
029         * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
030         * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}).
031         * Currently the length of the visible is fixed (the length of the frame's diagonal).
032         * TODO: Find a smarter way to calculate the required line length
033         * (e.g., by intersecting with the frame outline).
034         * 
035         * @param line the algebraic (Hough) line
036         * @return the overlay element
037         */
038        @Override
039        public Roi makeRoi(HoughLine line) {
040                double xRef = line.getXref();
041                double yRef = line.getYref();
042                double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height)); //Math.sqrt(sqr(xRef) + sqr(yRef));
043                double angle = line.getAngle();
044                double radius = line.getRadius();
045                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
046                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
047                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
048                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
049                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
050                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
051                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
052//              float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
053//              float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
054//              float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
055//              float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
056//              float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
057//              float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
058                //Roi roi = new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
059                
060                double x1 = x0 + dy * length + 0.5;     // TODO: this correction should not be here!
061                double y1 = y0 - dx * length + 0.5;
062                double x2 = x0 - dy * length + 0.5;
063                double y2 = y0 + dx * length + 0.5;
064                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
065                path.moveTo(x1, y1);
066                path.lineTo(x2, y2);
067                Roi roi = new ShapeRoi(path);
068                return roi;
069        }
070        
071        public void markPoint(double xc, double yc, Color color) {
072                double markerSize = 2.0;
073                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
074                path.moveTo(xc - markerSize, yc);
075                path.lineTo(xc + markerSize, yc);
076                path.moveTo(xc, yc - markerSize);
077                path.lineTo(xc, yc + markerSize);
078                ShapeRoi cross = new ShapeRoi(path);
079                cross.setStrokeWidth(0.3);
080                cross.setStrokeColor(color);
081                this.addRoi(cross, true);
082        }
083
084}
